CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Violation of P1-1;Non-pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Pecuniary damage - reserved
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant is a NORP joint venture based in GPE , with legal personality under NORP law .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the Governor of GPE of GPE submitted a proposal to the President of GPE to co - fund a joint venture for strengthening and further improvement of trade links between GPE and GPE . The Governor also suggested that GPE should transfer title to a building in GPE to the future company , so that it could be used as its head office .
CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant company was founded by CARDINAL companies , including ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant 's articles of association were amended , the number of co - founders having increased to CARDINAL entities , including ORG and ORG of GPE ( “ the Fund ” ) . The ORG was stated to be acting on behalf of ORG ( “ NORP ” ) . Each founder was declared to hold PERCENT of the applicant 's share capital . While CARDINAL companies were to pay equal amounts of money for their shares ( ORG CARDINAL ) , the ORG undertook to transfer to the applicant company a title to the building valued at ORG CARDINAL , and belonging , as was stated in the articles of association , to NORP .
CARDINAL . On DATE Ukranaftoprodukt , acting on the ORG 's instructions , transferred title to an administrative building in GPE to the applicant . NORP continued to use the building as its LOC .

CARDINAL . According to the applicant 's amended articles of association , it was established mainly for the purposes of obtaining profit for the shareholders and for the creation of an infrastructure for the cooperation between NORP and ORG companies pursuant to intergovernmental decisions aiming at improving effectiveness of business links and implementation of joint programmes , such as the sale of oil , gas , wood , agricultural products ; legal advice ; organisation of exhibitions ; other commercial activities necessary for achieving the goals of the company . The applicant company enjoyed all the rights of a separate legal entity . The applicant 's shareholders were entitled to take part in its management , to receive a part of its profit , to be informed about its activities etc . The property of the applicant company consisted of the objects and money transferred to its share capital by the shareholders , as well as the funds received by the applicant from other sources . The shareholders did not enjoy separate rights over the objects transferred to the applicant as their contributions .

CARDINAL . In DATE ORG ( “ the City Administration ” ) instituted proceedings in ORG of GPE against the ORG , ORG and the applicant company , seeking recovery of title to the building , claiming that it owned the building and alleging that the title to the latter had been transferred to the applicant ultra vires .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court invalidated the transfer of CARDINAL DATE and ordered PERSON to give the building back to ORG . The court found that that the building belonged to ORG and that the ORG had not been entitled to transfer it to the applicant .
CARDINAL . Ukranaftoprodukt lodged a request for review of the decision of CARDINAL DATE with the panel of ORG for the review of judgments , rulings and resolutions ( the “ ORG ” ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the judgment of CARDINAL DATE and rejected the claim of ORG . The panel held that the claim had been lodged out of time and that there was no evidence that ORG was the lawful owner of the building .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Presidium of ORG rejected the request for supervisory review ( the “ protest ” ) of the resolution of DATE , lodged by the President of that court , as unsubstantiated .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Prosecutor General of GPE , following ORG request , lodged a protest with ORG ( the “ ORG ” ) , seeking supervisory review proceedings in the case . On DATE ORG , in the presence of the representatives of ORG office , allowed the protest , quashed the resolutions of DATE and DATE , and upheld the judgment of CARDINAL DATE . In its decision , the court summarised ORG arguments and found them substantiated . No other reasons were given for its decision . The parties were not invited to participate in the hearing before ORG . The applicant 's comments on the protest of ORG were not examined by ORG .
CARDINAL . According to the applicant , on DATE its articles of association were amended to the effect that the NORP authorities were no longer a shareholder .
CARDINAL . The Government contended that the ORG remained CARDINAL of the founders of the applicant company and , hence , the owner of PERCENT of its share capital .
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of the LAW read as follows :
“ A company shall be the owner of :
[ i ] NORP the property which its founders ... transferred to it ;
[ ii ] the objects which it produced ... ;
[ iii ] NORP the profit which it received ... ”
“ Participants and founders of a company may transfer to it as their contribution buildings ... , money ...
The contribution expressed in karbovatsi shall constitute the founder 's and participant 's share in the [ company 's ] statutory fund . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of the LAW read as follows :
“ In accordance with LAW , the arbitration courts shall have jurisdiction over economic cases .
The arbitration court is an independent body with jurisdiction over all economic disputes between entities , public and other bodies , and over litigation arising out of insolvency . ”
“ The Higher Arbitration Court shall be composed of the President , the First Deputy President , the President 's deputies , and the judges and [ it ] shall sit as :
ORG ;
the Presidium of ORG ;
the panels for the consideration of disputes and for the review of judgments , rulings , resolutions . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of LAW Procedure provided :
“ The Higher Arbitration Court shall consider cases :
CARDINAL ) in which CARDINAL of the parties is ... ORG ... ”

“ The lawfulness and reasoning of a judgment , ruling or resolution of an arbitration tribunal ... may be reviewed under the supervisory procedure upon the party 's request or following a protest by a prosecutor or his deputy , in accordance with this LAW and other laws of GPE .
The party 's request for review of a judgment ... shall be examined by ... the panel of ORG for the review of judgments , rulings and resolutions .
The following persons are empowered to lodge a protest :
ORG and his deputies ... ”
“ The arbitration court shall be entitled to review under the supervisory procedure the lawfulness and reasoning of a judgment , ruling , resolution on its own initiative ... ”
“ ... The panel ... shall review under the supervisory procedure :
CARDINAL ) a judgment and ruling concerning a dispute which was adjudicated by ORG ... ”

“ A judgment , ruling , resolution shall be reviewed by a panel of the President of ORG or his deputy and a judge of ORG . If they do not agree on the outcome of the review , the President of ORG or his deputy may report to ORG who decides the matter ...

A judgment , ruling , resolution shall be reviewed by the President of ORG or his deputy and CARDINAL judges of the panel , if the application of law or assessment of evidence in the case is difficult . In such a case , the decision shall be adopted by a majority of votes .

A judgment or ruling delivered by the Deputy President of ORG or delivered in the hearing in which he presided shall be reviewed by the President of ORG and CARDINAL judges of the panel . In such a case , the resolution shall be adopted by a majority of votes .
A judgment or ruling delivered by the President of ORG or in the hearing in which he presided shall be reviewed by ORG .
If necessary , the parties may be invited to give their explanations at the panel 's hearing . ”
“ The President of ORG , ORG of GPE or his deputies have a right to lodge with the ORG of ORG a protest against the resolution delivered by the panel of ORG for economic disputes .

A party to the proceedings has a right to lodge with the Presidium of ORG an application for supervisory review of the judgment or ruling delivered by the President of ORG in the hearing in which he presided ... ”
“ The President of ORG , ORG have a right to lodge with ORG a protest against the resolution delivered by ORG .
Following its deliberations , ORG shall adopt a resolution ... ”

“ An application for supervisory review ... shall be lodged with the arbitration court which adjudicated the case . If the supervisory review is to be carried out by ORG , the application , together with the case - file , shall be submitted by the relevant arbitration court to ORG within DATE following the receipt of the application .
The protest ... shall be lodged with the arbitration court competent to review the judgment ...
Copies of the application or protest shall be sent to the parties ...

The enforcement proceedings shall not be suspended if an application or a protest is lodged , save in the cases where the judgment ... concerns the transfer of money and the forced taking of property ... ”
“ An application ... and a protest must be lodged within DATE of the date of the judgment ... ”
“ Upon the receipt of a copy of the application for supervisory review ... or of a protest , a party shall send to the arbitration court , other parties ... [ its ] observations [ in reply ] .
The absence of the [ parties ' ] observations ... shall not prevent [ a court ] from carrying out the review . ”

“ The parties may participate in [ the proceedings on ] the review ... The prosecutor ... shall take part in [ the proceedings on ] the review , which were initiated upon [ his ] protest . The non - appearance of the parties or the prosecutor ... shall not prevent [ the court ] from carrying out the review ...
The supervisory review ... shall be completed within DATE of the receipt of an application or protest ...
A judgment , ruling , resolution of the arbitration court may be reviewed under the supervisory procedure no later than within DATE after their delivery . ”
“ ... [ T]he arbitration court has power :
[ i ] NORP to leave a judgment , ruling , resolution without changes ;
[ ii ] to change a judgment , ruling , resolution ;
[ iii ] to quash a judgment , ruling , resolution , and to adopt a new judgment , remit a case for a fresh consideration , discontinue the proceedings , or leave a case without consideration .
A judgment , ruling , resolution ... shall be reviewed as a whole , irrespective of the grounds for an application for supervisory review or a protest .
An arbitration court reviewing a judgment , ruling , resolution under the supervisory procedure shall have all the powers of an arbitration court considering an economic dispute .

The supervisory review of a judgment , ruling , resolution by the Higher Arbitration Court shall be final , save when a party is outside the territory of GPE and there is an agreement between the relevant GPE for a different procedure of review . ”
CARDINAL ) NORP incomplete examination of the circumstances relevant to a case ;
CARDINAL ) NORP lack of proof of the relevant circumstances established by a court ;
CARDINAL ) NORP lack of conformity of the conclusions [ of a court ] ... with the circumstances of a case ;
CARDINAL ) NORP violation or incorrect application of substantive or procedural law ... ”
“ A judgment , ruling , resolution of an arbitration court shall be final and binding on DATE of their delivery ... ”
